Open your Gallery, then choose the GoPro folder. Once you select the GoPro folder, press and hold a thumbnail to jump start the multi-selection process. Tap on each photo or video that you want to transfer and save to the SD card. Tap the three-dot icon ( ) located in the top right corner. Choose the Move to Album option. Tap Create Album to make a new album on your SD card. Create a name for the new album. Select SD card as location then tap Create . It should be emphasized that you can t automatically save any new GoPro videos or photos to your SD card. This can only be done manually. It s best if you do this on a regular basis. Put your microSD card in your Quik Key. Plug your Quik Key USB to your Android smartphone or tablet. Tap on Start Pairing , then on GoPro SD card option. Look at the bottom right corner and tap Select . All photos and videos on your GoPro SD card are now ready to be selected in Quik. If you don t see the SD card option it means your card doesn t have the proper format or configuration. To format your card, go to Phone Settings > Storage & USB > SD card and format. But remember to back up all the files on the card first as formatting it will erase all its content. It s important to format your card so it will be recognized next time.
